title: musafar37
author: musafar37
created_time: January 18, 2023, 06:19:31 AMLast edit: January 18, 2023, 01:04:59 PM by musafar37
content: Many people who are new to cryptocurrency sit with a desire in their heart to become millionaires in a short time. From this desire,he began to discover various methods, Among these methods,The most dangerous approach is the tempting offer of various telegrams group. A greedy investment in Telegram Group means you lose your crypto assets.There is no doubt about it. In order to begin with,let me first point out the importance of setting this in your mind,THERE ¬†is no quick way to success. In addition,there is another big scam on YouTube channels,where they show that Binance is going to be listed in the last few days,and they ask the viewers to purchase some coins.To purchase the coins,you have to pay a certain amount of Bsc fees. I have been cheated a lot while buying through trustwallet. Gradually I learned to understand that all these are frauds. So beginners should leave the dream of being a shortcut millionaires man from the head, please spend time in the forum to acquire your own wealth and acquire strategies to protect the acquired wealth. I have put some example images below for easy understanding.Trust wallet :YouTube scamers:I have mentioned a case of cheating that happened to me, someone else may have been cheated in other ways. I want my case to be a lesson to you.The pain of losing hard-earned money, no one but the victim will understand.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: I'm glad your eyes are now open, and thanks for letting the novice people know about your ordeal. It's not new to me the vices of scammers on the internet, it's we that should very be careful of those things that are too good to be true. Many people want to get rich quickly, but is this possible without following due process? I guess not.There has been HYIP many decades before cryptocurrency, and people were scammed for it, and scammers are still using this style in the name of cryptocurrency. People have to be careful about this.Social media is their main target, and that is why many warnings and disclaimers have been issued to those that care to listen. And the closest-fetched one¬†is on the site of "Onentrepreneur" where everyone was tipped to be careful of the scams in the name of trust wallets.Source: Beware Of Trust Wallets Scam

comments.author: Outhue
comments.body: Even if you want to claim these airdrops can't you just ask from the official group? This is the fastest way of bursting scam airdrops, for example Sushi isn't doing any airdrops it's all fraud, but as a newbie, if you are confused or not sure you could just ask the team, there you go. There is a 100% chance that the team will tell you they aren't running any airdrops at the moment.To know the official group and channels always use coinmarktcap, you've learned your lesson.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: @OP it's better if you learn how to resize image since there's no need to show all of those images in full size, just add "width=300" in your each image.It's not a cheater, but scammer. Cheater is mostly where someone is abusing or breaking a rules, while scamming is mostly about money involved where you will get the money from someone and someone lost his money. It's nothing new for scammer ask to deposit some fee, don't need to get tricked by such scam in the future.

comments.author: ThemePen
comments.body: Hey OP please resize your image first.Second here are two tips which will help you to know about any coin real or fake?1. Check where is it listed? Is it listed on coinmarketcap or on coingecko? If it is listed so next...2. Check the contract address of the coin. You should match this contract address with that address from where you received that coins. Second one is most important to safe yourself from funds loss or hack. So be careful.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Please read this topic ---> Guideline on posting images (with size adjustments), hyperlinks and then reformat the topic, most of us will not read the topic in its current form due to the difficulty of reading it.Anyone who tells you that this is a golden opportunity to get rich in a short period without having a real use of what he is trying to convince you of or a revolutionary idea that gives him value is either a fraud or a fool who does not understand what he is talking about.

comments.author: Ryker1
comments.body: Good to see you have opened your eyes to this kind of scam because this is not new, Trust wallet has been an issue like this for how many years and that is because there are too many greedy users around. Check these threads,[ https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5267290.0 ] created by @$crypto$[ https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5394696.0 ] created by @LuciusThere are of scammed that happen on Trust wallet not just because of the wallet itself but the user on it.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: ThemePen on January 18, 2023, 11:11:43 AMHey OP please resize your image first.Yeah the images are too big and eating a lot of space for a content. OP should learn this first prior to focusing on the investments he mentioned.OP, I think that you are not alone in trying to be a millionaire someday by means of crypto but we have to make sure that what we go through are not scam projects cause at the end of the day, maybe instead of earning and gaining we are going through a series of losses due to these scammers scheme.

comments.author: armanda90
comments.body: This scammer way have running for several years ago and I don't know why you miss many board accusation about private key giving as scammer way right now take your fees transaction. Have been old method used by scammer by giving private key of trustwallet or metamask and there has several fund, when sending fees directly have settle with bot sending of fees.But your eyes open right now because there are have one wallet with stable coin or USDT there about $10,000, many people got scam by sending their fees and directly bot sending to scammer wallet. Keep sharing to your friend and never trust any one here if want to give free with their assets in trustwallet or metamask wallet.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: musafar37 on January 18, 2023, 06:19:31 AMis the tempting offer of various telegrams group. A greedy investment in Telegram Group means you lose your crypto assets. There is no doubt about it.People fell victims more to scams from telegram group when it was a new strategy from scammers, a lot of people have been scammed already through that telegram method and many other persons know about it. It is such a pity that people still fall victims to it presently. Don't trust any group talking about Investment on Telegram, newbies should read and know this.Quote from: musafar37 on January 18, 2023, 06:19:31 AMIn order to begin with, let me first point out the importance of setting this in your mind,THERE ¬†is no quick way to success.Any quick route to success is always accompanied by regrets. As much awareness is being raised already about cryptocurrency by members of this forum, make it a plan not to talk about investments in cryptocurrency as a get-rich quick scheme.

comments.author: I_Anime
comments.body: I literally try to stay off shitcoins aside from the fact that it may be a scam coin they are not really promising as they are spoken of.When dealing with shitcoins, be cautious YouTubers advice and avoid Telegram.Check this threads in order to avoid Scammers:[Guide] How to detect fake token and spot scammers.üåç[Guide] Prevent scam!!! Some useful tools for find scam / fake ICO team üåç

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: Just avoid shitcoins literally. Whether you know them or not, they're obviously just a bunch of pump-and-dump token schemes. Those shillers in the Telegram groups are hiring YouTubers and other influencers for them to add hype to what they're promoting.If you're too optimistic and greedy, you're the target market that they are about to scam. Don't be too gullible just because they've got an amazing advertisement and that's why most of us here are tirelessly telling everyone to buy bitcoin.

comments.author: Zlantann
comments.body: There might be other cryptocurrencies that claim to be a get-rich-quick scheme but I don't believe in them. This is because the majority of them turn out to be scams. People out of greed want to double their investments magically and most of them have ended up losing their funds suddenly. Social media is an important information bank but it is also a major channel for fraudulent activities. I am always skeptical about the information in social media that's why I always verify everything. But to be on the safer side, I only invest in Bitcoin because I don't have the time and space for many stories about other coins.

comments.author: CryptounityCUT
comments.body: Crypto scammers are individuals or groups who use fraudulent methods to steal money or personal information from individuals interested in cryptocurrency. These scams can take many forms, such as fake initial coin offerings, phishing attempts, and Ponzi schemes. It is important for individuals to be cautious and do their own research before investing in any cryptocurrency-related opportunity. Additionally, it is important to report any instances of suspected scamming to the appropriate authorities. Overall, crypto scammers are harmful to both the individuals they target and the reputation of the broader cryptocurrency industry.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: Quote from: musafar37 on January 18, 2023, 06:19:31 AMMany people who are new to cryptocurrency sit with a desire in their heart to become millionaires in a short time. From this desire,he began to discover various methods, Among these methods,The most dangerous approach is the tempting offer of various telegrams group. A greedy investment in Telegram Group means you lose your crypto assets.There is no doubt about it. In order to begin with,let me first point out the importance of setting this in your mind,THERE ¬†is no quick way to success. In addition,there is another big scam on YouTube channels,where they show that Binance is going to be listed in the last few days,and they ask the viewers to purchase some coins.To purchase the coins,you have to pay a certain amount of Bsc fees. I have been cheated a lot while buying through trustwallet. Gradually I learned to understand that all these are frauds. So beginners should leave the dream of being a shortcut millionaires man from the head, please spend time in the forum to acquire your own wealth and acquire strategies to protect the acquired wealth. I have put some example images below for easy understandingIf you are believing what these telegram groups are saying about making and investment and based on that you are making investment in any of the shitcoins then you are already in the wrong circle man and have full exposure of losing your funds.But the second one as you say if someone is trying to convince you that particular fake coin will be listed on Binance and you will pay fees in just this reason only? What is surety once it's listed it will grow as most of them are pump dump so even if they get listed the first one's to cash out profits will be the team and so called crypto influencers.So you have been provided with some scams through trust wallet also but once you give them access or invest in these projects you are on the verge of losing your funds which is why I always advise to turn off people adding you in any telegram group without your permission to be on safer side and always investigate about the project and check for the token address to validate it with original one but avoid them at best.

comments.author: JoyMarsha
comments.body: Newbies have received a lot of advice in this forum on how to avoid Telegram groups that promise them huge returns on their investments. Why do people constantly fall for telegram frauds, I wonder. Is it out of greed or do they want to try their luck at becoming millionaires quickly?It's good that you've realized that not all alternative cryptocurrencies are worthwhile investments, even if they promise to be listed on Binance shortly.In the case of crypto investment, nobody can be trusted in the crypto industry. That's why I avoid altcoins that make tempting offers to their investors because those projects usually turn out to be scams.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: I am glad that you learned it after some digging but you shouldn't believe all of the videso you can search or find in YouTube and in telegram groups. Most of the scammers are staying in telegram groups but as I say this, not all telegram groups are scam and it's just MOST of the groups are. Also be careful with a wallet where they give that has lots of balance or where you can see the value of it in dollars that it is huge or decent amount in dollars and you have to pay fee to be able to sell that fake crypto but when you send bnb on that wallet then you will see later that the btc you sent are being transferred to another wallet. In short, they give you a wallet with scam crypto and steal the bnb you sent in that wallet for transaction fee that it's supposed to be used.

comments.author: kamvreto
comments.body: Quote from: JoyMarsha on January 18, 2023, 05:26:33 PMNewbies have received a lot of advice in this forum on how to avoid Telegram groups that promise them huge returns on their investments. Why do people constantly fall for telegram frauds, I wonder. Is it out of greed or do they want to try their luck at becoming millionaires quickly?It's good that you've realized that not all alternative cryptocurrencies are worthwhile investments, even if they promise to be listed on Binance shortly.In the case of crypto investment, nobody can be trusted in the crypto industry. That's why I avoid altcoins that make tempting offers to their investors because those projects usually turn out to be scams.not only telegrams, even in several social media such as Twitter, Facebook and some email messages are also the cause. They were interested because they were promised a sizable prize. Greed is indeed the main factor why beginners can be fooled so easily. They only think of getting rich instantly in crypto regardless of the risks that will occur, such as the scammer's trap.Scammers use many methods to deceive their victims.The crypto industry is full of risks for those who don't understand and don't know what to choose which is safe. Many altcoins offer high bids, and provide great returns and bonuses, but in reality, they are all nonsense and in the end just become a waste of investment and do nothing.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Most of the scam projects make use of the telegram group to launch their ways for an attack and all they start with is the introduction of airdrops to members after fulfilling some task given on the platform, this task will require their social media handles and through that they got vulnerable unknowingly, at the end of it all they discovered that it's all a waste of time after lots of time and energy had been wasted on a chase after air so called airdrops, not starting with them is the best abstainance than engaging their services at the end of the day they phish on your account details and use them to attack you.

comments.author: Issa56
comments.body: Most newbies believe immediately they join cryptocurrency, then they are already millionaire but after joining and they notice they are not making money, then they start looking for easy ways to make money, whenever they come across things like this, they always jump into it because they believe that's an opportunity for them, but they don't know they are jumping into scam. I think most newbies don't really understand what bitcoin and cryptocurrency is all about before joining it that's why they easily get scammed.
